title: lust_(haze/reverb)
body:
Normal height: 1.45m
Ability: time jump
Nimbis disaster level: None

Claiming [lust], so far little information of higher sin mystery.
Unlike other higher original sins, they always appear in pairs, and their height seems to be the size of a normal human.
They do not advocate [integrating human beings], and they also oppose [annihilating human beings].
According to their own statement, human civilization still has room for growth in their cognition, and their duty is to guide human development.
There is no need to be against them for the time being.

title: sword_art_online:_lost_song
body: [b]Sword Art Online: Lost Song[/b] (ソードアート・オンライン －ロスト・ソング－) is a 2015 action RPG game published by [[Bandai Namco]] for the [[PlayStation 3|PS3]], [[PlayStation Vita|PS Vita]], [[PlayStation 4|PS4]] and PC based on the [[Sword Art Online]] series. The game has an alternate storyline based on the Fairy Dance arc setting.

title: sword_art_online:_infinity_moment
body: [b]Sword Art Online: Infinity Moment[/b] (ソードアート・オンライン - インフィニティ・モーメント) is a game adaptation of the [[Sword Art Online]] series published by [[Bandai Namco]] and released in March 14, 2013 for the [[Playstation Portable]]. The game is based on an alternate stoyline of the Aincrad arc.
other_names: SAOインフィニティ・モーメント

title: sword_art_online:_hollow_fragment
body:
[b]Sword Art Online: Hollow Fragment[/b] (ソードアート・オンライン －ホロウ・フラグメント－) is a RPG game published by [[Bandai Namco]] released in April 24, 2014 for the [[PlayStation Vita]]. It is set in an alternative Sword Art Online storyline, just like [[Sword Art Online: Infinity Moment]].

A "Director's Cut" edition of the game titled [b]Sword Art Online RE: Hollow Fragment[/b] was released on [[PlayStation 4]] in July and August 2015, with new additions such as online play mode, additional bosses, among others.

title: night_wizard
body:
Tabletop role-playing game by FarEast Amusement Research. The first edition was released in 2002, and it is currently on its third edition.

It takes place during the modern day in an alternate Earth similar to our own, named "Far-The-Earth," where a powerful barrier called [i]Common Sense[/i] prevents most of humanity from realizing that magic and magical creatures exist. However, demon-like beings known as [i]Emulators[/i] constantly invade past this barrier to prey on human prana (life energy), and magic-wielding humans known as [i]Wizards[/i] must fight them.

An erotic PC game, [[Night Wizard Mahou Taisen]], was released in 2004. Also received a 13-episode TV anime series produced by Hal Film Maker in 2007.

Characters from the anime:

* [[Hiiragi Renji]]
* [[Shiho Elis]]
* [[Akabane Kureha]]
* [[Himuro Akari]]
* [[Anzelotte]]
* [[Bell Zephyr]]

title: su_(gyee)
body:
Su and [[Yan_(gyee)]] were childhood sweethearts who grew up in Kaigon together. Kaigon is the mecca of Ka. Because Ka's tolerance and protection of Gyee, the White Capes dare not intrude, so many Gyees made the city their home. Every major faction would visit Kaigon and recruit talented children. When he was 10 years old, Su was picked by the White Turbans to stay in Kaigon and learn magic. Yan was selected by the Shadowhunters for training in Westhold. The pair made a pact to reunite in Kaigon after their decade's training is up.

Finally, the ten years were up. Su waited for Yan in Kaigon when he got a letter from Yan that he had received orders to defend the altar on the island of Broken Toe, so could only see Su at the dock. Su rushed out of the church but got there just as the ship left port, leaving them to stare longingly at each other.

[[gyee]]
https://gyee.fandom.com/wiki/Su

title: lan_(gyee)
body:
It takes ten years of grueling practice to become a great swordsman, then another ten years of testing your skills against other great swordsmen, followed by conquering the final trial, to earn the title of 'Swordmaster'. The trial entailed four phases: Overcoming objects, overcoming others, overcoming own earthly desires, overcoming own doubt.

Lan kept failing the last phase. Depressed, he shut himself in, drowned his sorrow in drinks and neglected his sword training. He was from a family of swordsman, but they never minded he was Gyee, though he himself could never truly accept the fact.

[[gyee]]
https://gyee.fandom.com/wiki/Lan

title: miles_(gyee)
body:
Miles was born to poor parents who abandoned him in the woods after realizing he was Gyee. A she-wolf found and raised him among a wolf pack, before he was forcibly taken to Azria by Markus. There, he received education and joined the Young Azrians. At the beginning, he was reclusive and antisocial, often fighting with peers, until the kind Eddie and gullible Izumi entered his life. With their influence, Miles gradually integrated into the group. 

[[gyee]]

https://gyee.fandom.com/wiki/Miles

title: eddie_(gyee)
body:
Born to a merchant family in Elysiann, Eddie moved from there to Azria when he was little, as his parents wanted a better life for him and Azria is more suited for traders, as well. Eddie is outgoing and kind, often helping people who then become friends. Izumi was one of them and the pair joined the Young Azrians. The reclusive Miles, a fellow member, caught Eddie's attention and he tried everything to get close and help Miles see his human side.

https://gyee.fandom.com/wiki/Eddie 

[[gyee]]

title: reinhardtzar
body:
An acting officer for the Idelva Kingdom, Reinhardtzar intends to serve up justice with every swing of his fists. He values honor above all else, so much so that his former subordinates from before his old unit was wiped out still look up to him. His outlook on life has changed ever since the Torhid incident, and he continues to search for the ideal path that sovereigns and their accompanying kingdoms should take.

https://gbf.wiki/Reinhardtzar

title: coat_on_shoulders
body:
A  [[coat]] draped over the shoulders, rather than worn with the arms in the sleeves.

While this may be done for a variety of reasons, the most common reasons are to cover up oneself, use as an improvised blanket to stay warm, or use as an improvised [[cloak]] or [[cape]].

title: pkp_pecheneg
body:
The PKP "Pecheneg" (Russian: Печенег) is a Russian machine gun chambered for the 7.62x54mmR round. It superseded the older [[pk_machine_gun|PK]] and [[PKM]] machine guns in Russian service in 2001.

It can be most easily distinguished from the earlier PKs by its carry handle - the PK and PKM have an L-shaped carry handle protruding above the receiver, while the PKP has an enclosed loop-shaped carry handle sitting flush at the same height as the receiver.

title: pk_machine_gun
body:
The PK machine gun is a Soviet general purpose machine gun, introduced in 1961.

This tag is for the original, earlier production of the PK machine gun, before it was modernized with the [[PKM]] in 1969. It can be distinguished from the PKM by its long flash hider, half-fluted barrel (fluted up to the gas block), and smooth top cover.

Both the PK and PKM were superseded by the [[pkp_pecheneg|PKP Pecheneg]] in 2001.

title: pkm
body:
PKM, or Pulemyot Kalashnikova Modernizirovanniy (Machine gun, Kalashnikov, Modernized), is a Soviet and Russian general-purpose machine gun in service since 1969, itself a modernized version of the [[pk_machine_gun|early PK]] design from 1961. Most often depicted with wooden grip, skeleton stock, and 100-round box magazine. Unlike American light machine guns, the ammunition belt is fed from the right side using a non-disintegrating belt link. 

This modernized version can be distinguished from the original [[pk_machine_gun|PK]] by a shorter flash hider; smooth barrel (the earlier one had the first half of the barrel fluted); and a ribbed top cover.

This gun is slated to be replaced by the [[PKP_Pecheneg|PKP Pecheneg]]. The best way to differentiate between the PKM and the PKP is the position of the carry handle; the Pecheneg's carry handle is right above the barrel while the PKM's carry handle protrudes above the receiver.

title: talavera
body:
Talavera is a Mexican pottery tradition from Puebla, Mexico. It features a distinct white base glaze with primarily blue accents but colors such as yellow, black, green, orange and mauve have also been used. Its production started in Puebla because of the quality of the natural clay found there. 

Majolica pottery was brought to Mexico by the Spanish in the first century of the colonial period.

h4. External links
* Wikipedia: "Talavera pottery":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Talavera_pottery

title: jester
body:
A jester was historically a [[medieval]] to [[Renaissance]] era entertainer who entered the [[house]] of a nobleman or monarch and was employed to entertain guests. They were also traveling entertainers who entertained ordinary people at [[festival]]s and [[town]]s. It is thought that jesters wore brightly colored clothes and eccentric [[hat]]s in a mottled pattern. The jester's other characteristics were their way of [[laughing]] and their mock [[scepter]].

title: arianespace
body: Arianespace is a company jointly established by European countries to launch [[rocket]]s developed and put into practical use by the European [[Space]] Agency.

title: ariane_5
body: Ariane 5 is a heavy-lift [[space]] launch vehicle developed and operated by [[Arianespace]] for the European Space Agency (ESA).

title: soyuz-fg
body: The Soyuz-FG launch vehicle was an improved Soyuz-U from the R-7 [[rocket]] family designed and built by TsSKB-Progress in Samara, [[Russia]].

title: roscosmos
body: The Roscosmos State Corporation for [[Space]] Activities, commonly known as Roscosmos, is a state corporation responsible for the wide range and types of space flights and cosmonautics programs for the [[Russia]]n Federation.

title: jaxa
body: The [[Japan]] Aerospace Exploration Agency (JAXA) is a national research and development agency responsible for Japan's aerospace development policy. The headquarters is located in Chofu, Tokyo.

title: falcon_heavy
body: The Falcon Heavy is a large, partially reusable launch vehicle designed and built by [[SpaceX]].

title: spacex
body: Space Exploration Technologies, traded as SpaceX, is a U.S. aerospace manufacturer and space transportation service company headquartered in Hawthorne, California.

title: houston
body: The largest city of the American state of [[Texas]] near the Gulf of Mexico. It is a major shipping port and center for petrochemical industries.

title: new_shepard
body: New Shepard is a vertical-takeoff, vertical-landing (VTVL), human-rated suborbital [[rocket]] that is being developed by [[Blue Origin]] as a commercial system for suborbital [[space]] tourism.

title: corn_ranch
body: Corn Ranch is a spaceport in Van Horn, [[Texas]], where [[Blue Origin]] is conducting flight tests on [[New Shepherd]]. Internet billionaire Jeff Bezos has bought 165,000 acres (670 square kilometers) of land. The first flight test took place on November 13, 2006 and was intended to offer commercial sightseeing flights.

title: bigdog
body:
[b]BigDog[/b] was a dynamically stable quadruped military [[robot]] created by [[Boston Dynamics]]. Instead of wheels, BigDog used four legs for movement, allowing it to move across surfaces that would defeat wheels.

It was funded by the DARPA in the hopes that it would be able to serve as a robotic pack mule to accompany soldiers in terrain too rough for vehicles, but the project was shelved after BigDog was deemed too loud to be used in combat.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: BigDog":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BigDog
* "Youtube: Boston Dynamics Big Dog":https://youtu.be/cNZPRsrwumQ

title: amakusa_shino
body:
One of the leading characters of [i][[Seitokai Yakuindomo]][/i]. She is the student council president of Ousai Private High School, formerly an all-girls school. While intelligent, beautiful and popular amongst the student body, she is also prone to perverted thoughts. Suffers from a mild complex about her [[small_breasts|bust size]]. [spoilers]May have feelings for her [[Tsuda Takatoshi|vice president]].[/spoilers]

Voiced by [[Hikasa Youko]].

title: mitsuba_mutsumi
body: Supporting character in [[Seitokai Yakuindomo]]. A hardworking judo fighter, Mutsumi's innocence and purity are such that she's almost always asking either [[Hagimura Suzu]] or [[Tsuda Takatoshi]] about what the [[amakusa_shino|other]] [[shichijou_aria|two]] members of the student council are talking about, to which they never answer. She has long black hair often kept in a ponytail. Seems to have feelings for Tsuda.

title: platelet_(hataraku_saibou)
body:
A personification of various platelets featured in the manga and anime series [i][[Hataraku Saibou]][/i].

They are depicted as [[child|children]] wearing a [[oversized_shirt|long blue shirt]], [[shorts]], a yellow [[satchel]], and a [[baseball cap]] with the word 血小板 (Platelet). They are usually depicted having a [[whistle]] and holding a yellow [[flag]] with the word for "No Entry", depicting the role of platelets for covering an open wound of a human.

While there are large numbers of platelets featured in the series, the one that stands out from the others and became a favorite character of the series is the one with long brown hair and brown eyes that was blocking the road in chapter 1, later revealed to be their leader. Said platelet has later gained similar [[meme]] status to [[Kanna Kamui]] from [i][[Kobayashi-san chi no Maidragon]][/i], as both were popular [[loli]] characters and voiced by [[Naganawa Maria]].
other_names: まったく、血小板は最高だぜ!!

title: animation_paper
body:
Standardized paper used in the [[traditional media|traditional]] hand-drawn animation process, usually features [[trim marks]] to show the framing of the [[cel]], and punched holes at the top to be held in alignment with other sheets in an animation [[peg bar]].

May feature differently colored line art ([[color trace]]) or annotations such as the scene number being depicted or timing information.  Sometimes seen in pre-production [[animatic]]s giving a rough feel for the intended animation.

h4. See also

* [[production art]]
* [[animatic]]
* [[trim marks]]
* [[peg bar]]
* [[cel]]
* [[traditional media]]

title: red_dragon
body:
Red Dragon (レッドドラゴン) is a Role-Playing-Fiction project involving Kinoko Nasu, Gen Urobuchi, Ryohgo Narita, Izuki Kougyoku, the author of the light novel Mimizuku to Yoru no Ou, and Simadoriru, who works with the Stripe Pattern doujin circle. Hosted by the publisher Seikaisha, it is a six day tabletop RPG session with Makoto Sanda as the Fiction Master.

It was later loosely adapted into the anime [i][[Chaos Dragon]][/i].

title: family
body:
A social unit composed of parents and their children (at least one).

Parents don't necessarily need to be biological, guardians are fine too as long as they are part of the same household.
In case one of the parents is deceased this tag may be used with only one parent and their children. 

Additionally grandparents and extended family may be included in the image, but only if the family itself is complete.
Complete being all living parents and their children. 

[b]When it's only a single parent with one child use the following tags instead:[/b]
* [[mother and daughter]] 
* [[mother and son]] 
* [[father and daughter]] 
* [[father and son]] 
* [[grandfather and grandson]]
* [[grandfather and granddaughter]]
* [[grandmother and grandson]]
* [[grandmother and granddaughter]]

title: trim_marks
body:
Trim marks, aka crop marks, are used to show where to physically crop the image after printing it.  This is used when the size of the final product doesn't quite match a standard paper size.

Additionally, the extra margin allows the artist to "bleed" color beyond it and ensure that mistakes in trimming do not ruin the final product.

The Japanese word is Tonbo (トンボ).  Unfortunately, this is also a homophone for [[dragonfly]] in Japanese, which is what most "Pixiv searches":http://www.pixiv.net/tags.php?tag=%E3%83%88%E3%83%B3%E3%83%9C will turn up.

h4.  See also

* [[color bars]]
* [[production art]]
* [[animation paper]]
* [[animatic]]
* [[color trace]]
* [[Tag group:Image composition]]

title: renault_5_turbo
body: A small hatchback manufactured by Renault. While it was outwardly an inane car, the Renault 5 Turbo was a purpose-built rally car, complete with a mid-mounted turbo engine and rear wheel drive.

title: lancia_stratos
body:
A two-door mid-engined sports [[car]] created by Lancia in the 70s. Small and light, it was powered by a Ferrari V6 engine and dominated the World Rally Championship in its time. The concept behind it (creating a rally car that could be made road legal) was later embodied in the Group B category.

h4. See also

title: zenkoku_seifuku_bishoujo_grand_prix
body:
An adult puzzle game/visual novel released by Lyceen in 1996, with a sequel series [i]Seigra '97[/i] released the very next year.  This work would also promote the creation of the [i]Find Love[/i] series of dating simulation games, starting with [i]Find Love:  Rhapsody[/i] released in 1999.

This game was one of the first to display nude women with pubic hair, though actual details of sexual organs were still left blank.  The game was divided into five "areas" covering different sectors of Japan (North, East, West, South and Middle), with seven girls of high school age allocated to each area.  Once the game was published, fans would vote on various characters; such tallies were noted on in illustration books that showed stills from the game published by 1998.  This series' character designer is [[yamada_masaki|Yamada Masaki]], who later did artwork for [[bubblegum_crisis_2040|Bubblegum Crisis 2040]].

title: men_in_black
body:
A science-fiction comedy film series based on Malibu / Marvel comic book series of the same name and chronicling the adventures of the titular secret agency as it monitors and polices extraterrestrial life on Earth. It is most well-known for the first three films (the first being in 1997) starring [[Will Smith]] as [[Agent J|James Edwards/Agent J]] and [[Tommy Lee Jones]] as [[Agent K|Kevin Brown/Agent K]], though there is a fourth spin-off film, 2019's [I]International[/I], starring Chris Hemsworth and Emma Thompson.

title: tohno_shiki_(2)
body:
A character from [[Tsukihime]]. A male teenager with shoulder-length [[white hair]] and [[red eyes]], often seen wearing [[japanese clothes]].

[spoiler]He is the original Tohno Shiki, the one who has Tohno blood and becomes possessed by [[michael_roa_valdamjong|Roa]] in Tsukihime. To be distinguished from the other Tohno Shiki, who is actually [[Nanaya Shiki]].[/spoiler]

Usually written as 遠野 シキ (Tohno SHIKI, upper case), in order to distinguish him from [[Tohno Shiki]], the protagonist of Tsukihime, whose name has the same pronunctiation.

title: terashima_marina
body:
A character from the adult visual novel [[zenkoku_seifuku_bishoujo_grand_prix|Zenkoku Seifuku Bishōjo Grand Prix]] produced by the Lyceen company in 1996.  She was a contestant in the Middle Area group of girls.  In the final tally of fan votes as noted on in the Bunkasha Official Illustrated Book series 003 showing stills from the game, Marina came in first place with 1136 votes.  

That vote did not allow her to be used as a character in the follow-on dating simulation game produced from [i]Grand Prix[/i], [i]Find Love:  Rhapsody[/i].  However, Marina's popularity would see her appear in Volume Six of the series, titled [i]The Grand Final[/i]; she would be the only one of the Middle Area characters to be allowed to do this.

In the final tally of fan votes as noted on in the Bunkasha Official Illustrated Book series 005 showing stills from the game, Kyōko came in first place with 1208 votes.

Kyōko's popularity would see her declared the overall winner of the Grand Prix, allowing her to appear in Volume Six of the series, titled [i]The Grand Final[/i]; she would be the only one of the East Area characters to be allowed to do this.  She would also appear in future sequels of the series, namely the dating simulation game [i]Find Love:  Rhapsody[/i] and other games that would attempt to bring the characters to a wider audience.

title: kite_(chimera_ant)
body:
Character from [[Hunter x Hunter]].

Kite is a stern and stoic young girl. She has [[long_hair|long]] [[red hair]], [[purple eyes]], [[freckles]] and a [[mouse_tail|rat-like tail]]. She wears a [[long_sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[black shirt]] with [[turtleneck]], [[black pants]] and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[shoes]].

[spoiler][[kite_(hunter_x_hunter)|Kite]] was a hunter and [[Ging Freecss]]' student. After his death, he was reborn as [[Meruem]]'s twin sibling and a member of the Chimera Ant Royal Family. She was originally named Reina, after [[Colt_(hunter_x_hunter)|]]'s sister, but took to calling herself Kite once again.[/spoilers]

title: lombax
body:
The lombax race is a recurring species in the [[ratchet_&_clank|Ratchet & Clank series]], and the species of the main protagonist [[ratchet_(ratchet_&_clank)|Ratchet]]. It is a humanoid, feline-like species of renowned engineers hailing from planet Fastoon in the Polaris Galaxy. 

They have developed some of the universe's most advanced technology in the form of powerful weaponry and fast spaceships, and have an innate affinity towards machinery. Notable lombax technology include the OmniWrench and the Hoverboots.

title: sukima_onna
body:
隙間女 ([i]Sukima onna[/i], literally "gap woman") is a Japanese urban legend, and also the name of the entity itself.

A woman (there’s also a male version) was living alone, and when she was in her room she sometimes felt like someone was watching her. This room was on the third floor so it was hard to believe anyone could be looking in from outside. She searched the house but of course she didn't find anyone hiding in any of the rooms, and didn't see any holes in the walls either. And then one day, she found the person who had been staring. It was a woman standing in the several-millimeter gap between the drawer and wall in her room, and she was still staring at her...

The Japanese comedian and actor, "Sakura Kinzou,":http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%A1%9C%E9%87%91%E9%80%A0 is also known for telling ghost stories; this story is his representative work. His version is the following kind of story.

Kinzou's coworker didn't come to work so he visited the house and asked his coworker what happened. He said “I was told by ‘her’ not to go." When the narrator asked where ‘she’ was, he pointed towards the kitchen. And when the narrator looked into the kitchen, he saw a woman with a flattened body standing in the small gap between the refrigerator and the wall.

"Mimi-bukuro,":http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E8%80%B3%E5%9A%A2 a collection of pieces written in the Edo period by "Negishi Shizumori,":http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%A0%B9%E5%B2%B8%E9%8E%AE%E8%A1%9B contains a similar story:
A successful [[wagashi]] storekeeper moved into a new home.  After that, something was wrong with the sliding door on the second floor. When a servant tried to open it, it only opened halfway for some reason. When the storekeeper tried the door opened without any problem. The next day it wouldn't open, so one of the servants forced it open. Suddenly a woman appeared from the tight space for containing the door and grabbed at the servant. He panicked and forced her back, and she vanished.

h4.See also

* [[Yakumo Yukari]], a [[Touhou]] character loosely based on this creature.
* [[Tag Group:Legendary Creatures]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia (JP): 隙間女":http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E9%9A%99%E9%96%93%E5%A5%B3

title: kiseijou_rei_(goddess_form)
body:
The unnamed (although nicknamed by fans as Cyan Heart, Blue Heart or simply Rei Heart) goddess [[transformation]] of [[Kiseijou Rei]], as seen in [[Kami Jigen Game Neptune V]].

Rei's goddess form is reminiscent of her human form, having the same long heather [[blue hair]] but becomes slightly more sky-blue [[gradient hair|as it goes down]]. Her [[blue eyes|eyes are a bright diamond blue]] with glowing white warning [[symbol-shaped pupils]] and the horn-shaped [[hair ornament]] that she wears on her head in human form becomes doubled, now appearing on both sides, and more curved and organic-looking. Her glasses are gone and the general look of her outfit remains but in a bodysuit form, exposing her greatly [[breast expansion|enlarged]] [[large breasts|chest]], and the top some of her thighs, starting a little over where the torso begins and little over the middle of her thigh. The outfit itself is still primarily black and with white sections much like her previous form.

When she transforms, the only word needed to describe her is "psycho." Rei becomes extremely irrational, unreasonable, and overbearing. In her human form, Rei makes a comment stating that whenever she gets a little power in her hands that she goes insane. Her goddess form is living proof of this statement due to her easily being the most powerful goddess in existence.

title: ujikintoki_tamaryu
body:
An [[original]] character by [[Rakurakutei Ramen]]. A "recently" reborn female dragon who's taken the form of a young human girl with [[short_hair|short]] [[blue hair]] and a lumpy [[single horn]] growing from the left side of her head. When sufficiently agitated, she can change her arm into that of her dragon form, punching with great strength or wielding mauling claws.

Tamaryu lives at the Karindou shop with her "sisters" [[ujikintoki_kinka|Kinka]] and [[ujikintoki_ginka|Ginka]], and adoptive "mother", [[kamishiro_seren|Seren]]. 

More recently, she's often seen hanging around with [[Kagurazaki Shizuki]] and later [[Ran Straherz]] as part of a new "Holy Trio", and as students at a new school for Youkai. During the course of the series, she begins receiving mentorship under [[Tatsuta Rindou]] of the "Holy Trio".  

Apparently, the author previously planned releasing a game starring Tamaryu, Shizuki, and [[takekushi_meguru|Meguru]] defeating a secret society together, but it was never actually released.  Nevertheless, it is the backstory of how Shizuki and Tamaryu met in the comics, although the exact details are never fully explained.

title: tiltrotor
body:
A tiltrotor is an [[aircraft]] which generates lift and propulsion by way of one or more powered rotors mounted on rotatable engine pods or nacelles usually at the ends of a fixed wing, pylon, or similar structure. 

On Danbooru the tag refers to rotatable engine pods, whether they are attached to aircraft, girls or mecha.

title: oinari-sama_(kemono_friends)
body:
A [i][[Kemono Friends]][/i] character.

Inari Ookami is the japanese deity of agriculture, rice, foxes and many other things. They are represented in many forms but none is technically correct.

Oinari-sama is a Cryptid Friend based on the fox aspect of the deity as well as the patron deity of the red foxes.

She is dressed in an all-white blazer uniform similar to [[ezo_red_fox (kemono_friends)|Ezo Red Fox]] and [[silver_fox (kemono_friends)|Silver Fox]] with bows on the blazer instead of buttons and a red bow to add a splash of color and to replace the other's neckties and scarves. She wears no pantyhose, instead prefering traditional tabi and geta with an extra ribbon tied around her left thigh. Obviously, she also has fox ears and tail, all-white except for the interior of her ears which are pink. A golden ring or ribbon surrounds her tail near the tip.
other_names: オイナリサマ(けものフレンズ)

title: mary-san
body:
Evil entity that appeared(?) in a Japanese modern ghost story/urban legend, メリーさんの電話 (Phone calls from Mary-san). It was adapted into a 2011 film. 

An abandoned doll terrorizing her previous owner with phone calls from slowly advancing points before calling the last time that she's right behind the owner. 

This short & nice story is also notorious for its countless joke variants.

title: wakfu
body: [b][i]Wakfu[/i][/b] is a tactical turn-based MMORPG, developed by [i]Ankama Games[/i]. Development began in 2006, and the game was released for [i]Microsoft Windows, macOS[/i], and [i]Linux[/i] on February 29, 2012. The game takes place 1,000 years after Ankama's previous game, [[Dofus]]. An animated television series based on the game began airing in France from October 30, 2008.

body:
There is a cat. Thank you very much.

They also feel a cat consistently staring at them in dark places. The infection can spread via description by the infected.[/spoiler]

Subject of the [[SCP Foundation]].

title: ogino_minoru

title: rice_transplanter
body:
A rice transplanter is a specialized piece of agricultural equipment designed to [[rice planting|plant rice]] seedlings onto a [[rice paddy]]. There are two types of rice transplanter, a motorized self-driven variety, and a manually driven walking variety the operator pushes along. The self-driven variety is similar to a [[tractor]] with narrow wheels meant for driving in [[mud]] and a [[conveyor belt]] used to plant the seedlings.

title: segata_sanshirou
body:
A fictional character created by [[Sega]] to advertise the [[Sega Saturn]] in Japan between 1997 and 1998. He is a parody of Sugata Sanshirō, a legendary [[judo]] fighter from an [[kurosawa akira|Akira Kurosawa]] film.

Sanshiro is a dan holder for multiple Japanese martial arts (karate and iaidou first dan, judo third dan, battoudou fourth dan, toudou 7th dan, etc). He is portrayed by actor Fujioka Hiroshi, who, until that point, was best known for playing the hero Takeshi Hongo in the influential tokusatsu superhero series [[Kamen Rider]].

For Sega's 60th anniversary, in late March 2020, a new mascot was revealed, one who was Segata's son, called Sega Shirō (せが四郎), actually played by Fujioka Hiroshi's eldest son, Fujioka Maito.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Segata Sanshiro":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Segata_Sanshiro

title: radiant_silvergun
body:
[i][b]Radiant Silvergun[/b][/i] (レイディアント シルバーガン) is a [[science fiction]] vertical shoot 'em up [[video game]] by [[Treasure (developer)]]. It debuted in arcades in 1998 on the S-TV [[arcade]] board and sequentially saw a port to the [[Sega Saturn]]. 

The game features a unique weapon system different from other shooters; instead the traditional power-up items found in other games, the eponymous Silverguns are equipped with seven different weapons that can be powered-up by using that particular weapon and effective scoring. 

Among the Silverguns' arsenal is a powerful sword that can perform a devastating attack upon filling a special attack meter. It's other unique aspect was its chain scoring system where by destroying three enemies of the same color will result in a "Chain Bonus" that accumulates as the player chain the same-colored enemies in succession.

It is one of the most sought-after Sega Saturn games around; it was never released outside Japan unfortunately, and import copies of the game can fetch around high prices at auction sites due to its rarity and legacy. Thankfully, in 2011, it saw an enhanced re-release on [[xbox_360|Xbox 360]] for 1,200 Microsoft Points ($15 U.S. Dollars) via Xbox LIVE Arcade, with optional HD graphics, English translated subtitles, and online multi-player.

h4. See also

* [[ikaruga|Ikaruga]], Radiant Silvergun's spiritual successor.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Radiant Silvergun":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Radiant_Silvergun
other_names: レイディアントシルバーガン

title: ishii_o-ren
body:
A female assassin from the film [[Kill Bill]], and former member of the DVAS. Born from a Japanese mother and a Chinese American father, after seeing her parents brutally murdered at the age of 9, O-Ren took violent revenge on their murderers just two years later and went on to become a professional assassin proficient in sword fighting.

Her attire after leaving the DVAS is a formal kimono, which she adopted after becoming the queen of the Yakuza in Tokyo, backed by [[Yuubari Gogo]], Johnny Mo, Sofie Fatale and her personal army known as the "Crazy 88."

Her weapon of choice is a [[shirasaya]] [[katana]].

Codename: "Cottonmouth"

title: ucc_coffee
body:
UCC Ueshima Coffee Co., Ltd. (UCC上島珈琲株式会社, Yū Shī Shī Ueshima Kōhī Kabushiki-gaisha) is a manufacturer of [[coffee]] and tea products in Kobe, Hyōgo. UCC stands for Ueshima Coffee Company.

The brand is often seen in conjunction with [[Neon Genesis Evangelion]], due to a joint advertising campaign.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: UCC Ueshima Coffe Co.":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UCC_Ueshima_Coffee_Co%2E]
